description: QueryFilter provides way of providing complex filtering on IQueryable<> with dynamic expression trees. With one property, you can do multiple filters, ands, ors, contains, less than, not equals, etc for anything that implements IQueryable. This also applies to Entity Framework. You also get the ability to add grouping to your queries with a very simple syntax. Best of all, you only have to work with the filter properties. You simply send your filter object and the query you want to apply the .Where clause to and QueryFilter takes care of the rest! You can even deserialize JSON into your filter if you want the UI to be able to apply these complex filters!
releaseNotes:
- Fixed a bug when the first sub item in a filtergroup is another filtergroup
- Changed the Id field to be a string instead of a guid since we just need distinct values to say this expression is part of this group vs just being by itself and assumed And at the end of the where clause
- Added ability to do a where on string length
summary: QueryFilter provides way of creating complex filtering on IQueryable<> with dynamic expression trees in a simple way!
title: QueryFilter
